title: Literacy Learning Ecosystems and Decolonialism: Microlearning in Science Fields

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of scientific disciplines and digital literacy
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environment with modular content enabling learning on the move

learning_goals: Learners can analyze structural characteristics of literacy learning ecosystems from a postcolonial perspective.
Learners acquire methods to critically evaluate linguistic boundaries embedded in scientific texts.

Over a 3-week midterm course, learners reconstruct ≥10 science concepts using mobile learning strategies (location-based quizzes, AR content exploration) on a microlearning platform, achieving "excellent" ratings in ≥2 of 3 peer assessment rubric criteria (creativity, accuracy, applicability).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
